snippet: Security forces fired on rioters in Rakhine State, where a curfew is imposed to calm tensions between Buddhist residents and Muslims, many considered illegal settlers from nearby Bangladesh.
abstract: Security forces in western Myanmar fire on rioters who burned hundreds of homes in an outbreak of sectarian violence that killed at least seven people; rioting reflects longstanding tensions in the state of Rakhine between Buddhist residents and Muslims, many of whom are considered to be illegal settlers from neighboring Bangladesh; there is fear that the trouble could spread elsewhere because of the religious divide.
lead_paragraph: Security forces fired on rioters in Rakhine State, where a curfew is imposed to calm tensions between Buddhist residents and Muslims, many considered illegal settlers from nearby Bangladesh.

headline.seo: 7 Die in Sectarian Riots in Myanmar
headline.main: Deadly Riots Raise Muslim-Buddhist Tensions in Myanmar
headline.print_headline: Deadly Riots Raise Muslim-Buddhist Tensions in Myanmar
